wikipedia_page.main: Adam McIlroy Allan (12 September 1904 – after 1937) was a professional association footballer who played at Centre Half. He played for Falkirk, Sunderland, Reading and Queen of the South.

link_mentions.page: History of Queen of the South F.C.
response: That season of 1933–34 saw the club's highest-ever league finish, with fourth place in Scotland's top flight. Irish international Laurie Cumming scored 24 goals that season. Centre half Adam Allan and winger and local player Willie Anderson would also figure prominently. Among the scalps Queen's took that season were double victories over Celtic, Hibs and Hearts. Queen's reached the Scottish Cup quarter finals before losing to two deflected goals away to St Johnstone.
